quote: Obstacles are the cost of greatness.
author: Robin Sharma

quote: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Action is the real measure of intelligence.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: How bad do you want it?
author: Gary Vaynerchuk

quote: Blood, sweat and respect. First two you give. Last one you earn.
author: Dwayne Johnson

quote: Be so good they can’t ignore you.
author: Steve Martin

quote: All the power is within you. You can do anything.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: Show the world how much you’ll fight for the winners circle.
author: Pat Riley

quote: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: It’s not about excuses. You got a job to do there and do it. Find a way to be effective and not make excuses but just man up and play.
author: Kobe Bryant

quote: Learn to be comfortable in the uncomfortable. Learn to be peaceful, not bored. Learn to be inspired, not scared.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: What you want exists. Don’t settle until you get it.
author: Jay Shetty

quote: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot. Make it hot by striking.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Work hard, be kind, and amazing things will happen.
author: Conan O’Brien

quote: What’s the tiniest step you can take? Do that first.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: I can’t believe that God put us on this earth to be ordinary.
author: Lou Holtz

quote: I want the world to be better because I was here.
author: Will Smith

quote: Don’t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: There are four basic human needs; food, sleep, sex and revenge.
author: Banksy

quote: Motivation is a fire from within. If someone else tries to light that fire under you, chances are it will burn very briefly.
author: Stephen Covey

quote: Deep down you know what you want. Deep down you have what it takes.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: I wasn’t there to compete. I was there to win.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: To seek greatness is the only righteous vengeance.
author: Criss Jami

quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

quote: It’s hard to beat a person who never gives up.
author: Babe Ruth

quote: Man is what he believes.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: A great man is hard on himself; a small man is hard on others.
author: Confucius

quote: If you perform the sacrifice of doing your duty, you do not have to do anything else. Devoted to duty, man attains perfection.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: A person can achieve everything by being simple and humble.
author: The Vedas

quote: The most persevering becomes the most talented.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: To have become a deeper man is the privilege of those who have suffered.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You will earn the respect of all men if you begin by earning the respect of yourself.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: When you find peace within yourself, you also find peace without.
author: Naga Devi

quote: Knowledge will give you power, but character respect.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: The inner fire is the most important thing mankind possesses.
author: Edith Sodergran

quote: What you aim at determines what you see.
author: Jordan Peterson

quote: A wise man becomes free when he is ready to die at any moment.
author: Diogenes

quote: The ignorant work for their own profit; the wise work for the welfare of the world, without thought for themselves.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Once you’re calm and fit, you have everything worth having, as the rest just comes and goes.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Progress is made in solitude; profit is made in public.
author: Sven Schnieders

quote: You should think in such a way that everybody could look into your soul and see what is transpiring there.
author: Seneca

quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man’s character, give him power.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The wiser you get, the less you care to look like a fool.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: There is nothing with which every man is so afraid as getting to know how enormously much he is capable of doing and becoming.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Do not waste time on things you cannot change or influence.
author: Robert Greene

quote: We need men who can dream of things that never were.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: My idea of the modern stoic sage is someone who transforms fear into prudence, pain into information, mistakes into initiation, and desire into undertaking.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

quote: Conversation enriches the understanding, but solitude is the school of genius.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: You don’t succeed by being perfect. You succeed by doing good work, consistently.
author: Thibaut

quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
author: Plutarch

quote: Riches have shut off many a man from the attainment of wisdom.
author: Seneca

quote: Too many prefer gentle lies to hard truths.
author: Shane Parrish

quote: The ideals which have always shone before me and filled me with joy are goodness, beauty, and truth.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Truth hurts but what hurts makes you stronger.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: Nothing in this world is harder than speaking the truth, nothing easier than flattery.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: Discovering the truth about ourselves is a lifetime’s work, but it’s worth the effort.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: In the long run, the most unpleasant truth is a safer companion than a pleasant falsehood.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Only silence communicates the truth as it is.
author: Osho

quote: The further a society drifts from the truth, the more it will hate those that speak it.
author: George Orwell

quote: The things that we decide to run from are the truth. When you make excuses, you’re running from the truth.
author: David Goggins

quote: In order to be effective truth must penetrate like an arrow – and that is likely to hurt.
author: Wei Wu Wei

quote: The only way to tell the truth is to speak it with kindness. Only the words of a loving man can be heard.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: If you wish to see the truth, then hold no opinion for or against.
author: Osho

quote: If you’re seeking the truth then what you don’t know is more important than what you know.
author: Jordan Peterson

quote: I tore myself away from the safe comfort of certainties through my love for the truth; and truth rewarded me.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: The truth may be out there, but the lies are inside your head.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: The presence of those seeking the truth is infinitely to be preferred to the presence of those who think they’ve found it.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Telling the truth and making someone cry is better than telling a lie to make someone laugh.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: I speak the truth, not so much as I would, but as much as I dare; and I dare a little more as I grow older.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: The path that leads to truth is littered with the bodies of the ignorant.
author: Miyamoto Musashi

quote: There is nothing more necessary than truth, in comparison with it, everything else has only secondary value.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Those who have failed to work toward the truth have missed the purpose of living.
author: Buddha

quote: If you cannot find the truth right where you are, where else do you expect to find it?
author: Dogen

quote: The truth is like a lion; you don’t have to defend it. Let it loose; it will defend itself.
author: Augustine of Hippo

quote: Truth: something hard to say and hard to hide.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Truth is the best disinfectant.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: If you tell the truth, you don’t have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I intend to live forever. So far, so good.
author: Steven Wright

quote: Tomorrow is often the busiest day of the week.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: When I was a kid my parents moved a lot, but I always found them.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

quote: Rice is great when you’re hungry and you want 2000 of something.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: I remixed a remix, it was back to normal.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: The best way to teach your kids about taxes is by eating 30 percent of their ice cream.
author: Bill Murray

quote: I’m writing a book. I’ve got the page numbers done.
author: Steven Wright

quote: A lot of people are afraid of heights. Not me, I’m afraid of widths.
author: Steven Wright

quote: I have always wanted to be somebody, but I see now I should have been more specific.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: Don’t be so humble – you are not that great.
author: Golda Meir

quote: I was trying to daydream, but my mind kept wandering.
author: Steven Wright

quote: I like Kit-Kat, unless I’m with four or more people.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: It’s okay if you don’t like me. Not everyone has good taste.
I live on a one-way street that’s also a dead end. I’m not sure how I got there.
author: Steven Wright

quote: People are like music. Some speak the truth, and others are just noise.
author: Bill Murray

quote: Going to church doesn’t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile.
author: Billy Sunday

quote: Never trust people who smile constantly. They’re either selling something or not very bright.
author: Laurell K. Hamilton

quote: I did not attend his funeral, but I sent a nice letter saying I approved of it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: Everything is changing. People are taking the comedians seriously and the politicians as a joke.
author: Will Rogers

quote: When life gives you lemons, squirt someone in the eye.
author: Cathy Guisewite

quote: That’s why they call it the American Dream, because you have to be asleep to believe it.
author: George Carlin

quote: I don’t understand why people would want to get rid of pigeons. They don’t bother no one.
author: Mike Tyson

quote: I like long walks, especially when they are taken by people who annoy me.
author: Fred Allen

quote: If you’re too open-minded; your brains will fall out.
author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

quote: If you think nobody cares about you, try missing a couple of payments.
author: Steven Wright

quote: Whoever established the high road and how high it should be should be fired.
author: Sandra Bullock

quote: Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac?
author: George Carlin

quote: If I’m not back in five minutes, just wait longer.
author: Ace Ventura, “Ace Ventura: Pet Detective”

quote: I like my money where I can see it: hanging in my closet.
author: Carrie Bradshaw, “Sex and the City”

quote: The suspense is terrible. I hope it’ll last.
author: Willy Wonka, “Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory”

quote: Why do they call it rush hour when nothing moves?
author: Robin Williams

quote: Don’t be so humble — you're not that great.
author: Golda Meir

quote: If you can’t be kind, at least be vague.
author: Judith Martin

quote: There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.
author: Oscar Wilde, “The Picture of Dorian Gray”

quote: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Candy is dandy, but liquor is quicker.
author: Ogden Nash, “Reflections on Ice Breaking”

quote: In real life, I assure you, there is no such thing as algebra.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: Instant gratification takes too long.
author: Carrie Fisher

quote: Accept who you are. Unless you’re a serial killer.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: Whoever said that money can’t buy happiness, simply didn’t know where to go shopping.
author: Bo Derek

quote: Before you criticize someone, walk a mile in their shoes. That way, you'll be a mile from them, and you'll have their shoes.
author: Jack Handy

quote: I’m not great at the advice — can I interest you in a sarcastic comment?
author: Chandler Bing, “Friends”

quote: I’m sick of following my dreams, man. I’m just going to ask where they’re going and hook up with ’em later.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.
author: Terry Pratchett, “Diggers”

quote: To call you stupid would be an insult to stupid people! I’ve known sheep that could outwit you. I’ve worn dresses with higher IQs.
author: Wanda, “A Fish Called Wanda”

quote: Those people who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: The reason I talk to myself is because I’m the only one whose answers I accept.
author: George Carlin

quote: I’m not superstitious … but I am a little stitious.
author: Michael Scott, “The Office”

quote: Here’s something to think about: How come you never see a headline like ‘Psychic Wins Lottery’?
author: Jay Leno

quote: If God wanted us to bend over he would put diamonds on the floor.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: It is useless to try to hold a person to anything he says while he’s madly in love, drunk, or running for office.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: You call it madness, but I call it love.
author: Don Byas

quote: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: To love is risky. Not to love is foolish.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: To love is to burn, to be on fire.
author: Jane Austen

quote: When the power of love overcomes the love of power the world will know peace.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: Even better than being loved is being in love.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Love isn’t finding a perfect person. It’s seeing an imperfect person perfectly.
author: Sam Keen

quote: I know of no greater happiness than to be with you all the time, without interruption, without end.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: We love because it’s the only true adventure.
author: Nikki Giovanni

quote: The more I think it over, the more I feel that there is nothing more truly artistic than to love people.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: True love stories never have endings.
author: Richard Bach

quote: Love’s greatest gift is its ability to make everything it touches sacred.
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: Love yourself. Then forget it. Then, love the world.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: Never make someone a priority when all you are to them is an option.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Him that I love, I wish to be free – even from me.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: In the end we discover that to love and let go can be the same thing.
author: Jack Kornfield

quote: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
author: James Baldwin

quote: Love must be as much a light as it is a flame.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: I wish I had done everything on Earth with you.
author: The Great Gatsby

quote: Love is not affectionate feeling, but a steady wish for the loved person’s ultimate good as far as it can be obtained.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Knowing, understanding and accepting yourself is your first step to everything you want in life.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: We must love one another or die.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: I love you, not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you.
author: Roy Croft

quote: Each time you love, love as deeply as if it were forever – only, nothing is eternal.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: Love is the expansion of two natures in such fashion that each include the other, each is enriched by the other.
author: Felix Adler

quote: A relationship where you can be weird together is your best choice.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: When your heart has room for everybody then your heart is full of love.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: There’s only one thing more precious than our time and that’s who we spend it on.
author: Leo Christopher

quote: Stay away from people who makes you feel like you are wasting their time.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: My experience is that the teachers we need most are the people we’re living with right now.
author: Byron Katie

quote: People are unreasonable, illogical, and self-centered. Love them anyway.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: My friends are my estate.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: I’ve come to understand that listening is one of the most important things we can do for one another… if we care, we can listen.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: When our friends are present, we ought to treat them well; and when they are absent, to speak of them well.
author: Epictetus (Enchiridion)

quote: When humans are ranked instead of linked, everyone loses.
author: Gloria Steinem (My Life on the Road)

quote: The more you judge, the more you separate yourself.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Politeness and consideration for others is like investing pennies and getting dollars back.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: Try to be a rainbow in someone’s cloud.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: There are many times when it is better to be kind than clever.
author: Thibaut

quote: Remember to stay away from people who have a problem for every solution.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Friendship isn’t a big thing – it’s a million little things.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Quit wanting them to be the way you want them to be. Just love them.
author: Kamal Ravikant

quote: Eliminate time spent with people who would rather drone on about their misery than hear about your successes.
author: Taylor Burrowes

quote: Everyone is normal until you get to know them.
author: Brent Beshore

quote: Never look up to anybody, never look down on anybody. You look them eye to eye.
author: Unknown

quote: We’re often afraid of being vulnerable, but vulnerability creates genuine connection.
author: Gabby Bernstein

quote: We humans definitely need other people to keep us human.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: So much of life is being present with the people you love.
author: Shane Parrish

quote: Seek first to understand, then to be understood.
author: Stephen R. Covey

quote: If you find it in your heart to care for somebody else, you will have succeeded.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read. It was books that taught me that the things that tormented me most were the very things that connected me with all the people who were alive, who had ever been alive.
author: James Baldwin

quote: You can’t have heartbreak without love. If your heart was really broken, then at least you know you really loved him.
author: Leila Sales, “Past Perfect”

quote: When we miss someone often, what we really miss is the part of us that with this someone awakens.
author: Luigina Sgarro

quote: One day you’re going to remember me and how much I loved you … then you’re going to hate yourself for letting me go.
author: Drake

quote: Every time your heart is broken, a doorway cracks open to a world full of new beginnings, new opportunities.
author: Patti Roberts

quote: And they can’t understand, what hurts more—missing the other person, or pretending not to.
author: Khadija Rupa

quote: Sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: My tongue will tell the anger of my heart, or else my heart, concealing it, will break.
author: William Shakespeare, “The Taming of the Shrew”

quote: I’d rather love a million times and have my heart broken every time, than hold a permanently empty heart forever.
author: H.C. Paye

quote: A broken heart is just the growing pains necessary so that you can love more completely when the real thing comes along.
author: J.S.B. Morse, “Now and at the Hour of Our Death”

quote: The broken heart. You think you will die, but you keep living, day after day after terrible day.
author: Charles Dickens, “Great Expectations”

quote: It is strange how often a heart must be broken before the years can make it wise.
author: Sara Teasdale

quote: ’Tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Stab the body and it heals, but injure the heart and the wound lasts a lifetime.
author: Mineko Iwasaki

quote: I’ve been heartbroken. I’ve broken hearts. That’s part of life, and it’s part of figuring out who you are so you can find the right partner.
author: Heidi Klum

quote: The heart was made to be broken.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Some people are going to leave, but that’s not the end of your story. That’s the end of their part in your story.
author: Faraaz Kazi

quote: My heart no longer felt as if it belonged to me. It now felt as it had been stolen, torn from my chest by someone who wanted no part of it.
author: Meredith Taylor, “Churning Water”

quote: There is an ocean of silence between us… and I am drowning in it.
author: Ranata Suzuki

quote: When you are in love, and you get hurt, it’s like a cut—it will heal, but there will always be a scar.
author: Soo Jie

quote: Love is never lost. If not reciprocated, it will flow back and soften and purify the heart.
author: Washington Irving

quote: A girl doesn’t need anyone who doesn’t need her.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Perhaps someday I’ll crawl back home, beaten, defeated. But not as long as I can make stories out of my heartbreak, beauty out of sorrow.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: The human heart is the only thing whose worth increases the more it is broken.
author: Shakieb Orgunwall

quote: To fall in love is awfully simple, but to fall out of love is simply awful.
author: Bess Myerson

quote: Friendship is a sheltering tree.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Good friends are hard to find, harder to leave and impossible to forget.
author: G. Randolf

quote: The ornament of a house is the friends who frequent it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Best friends don’t expect anything from you. They just accept you the way you are.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: I don’t like that man. I must get to know him better.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: True friendship is like sound health. The value of it is seldom known until it be lost.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: A friend is someone who helps you up when you’re down, and if they can’t, they lay down beside you and listen.
author: Winnie The Pooh

quote: Be true to your work, your word, and your friend.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: It’s not what we have, but who we have.
author: Winnie The Pooh

quote: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Friendship is not about whom you know the longest. It is about who came and never left.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: A friend is one of the nicest things you can have and one of the best things you can be.
author: Winnie The Pooh

quote: One friend in a storm is worth more than a thousand friends in sunshine.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo

quote: A friend is a gift you give yourself.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven’t yet met.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: I would rather walk with a friend in the dark, than alone in the light.
author: Helen Keller

quote: There cannot be friendship without equality.
author: Swami Sivananda

quote: Friendships that last have high connections, high mutual respect and low expectations.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: My definition of a friend is somebody who adores you even though they know the things you’re most ashamed of.
author: Jodie Foster

quote: Man’s best support is a very dear friend.
author: Cicero

quote: Friendship consists in forgetting what one gives and remembering what one receives.
author: Alexander Dumas

quote: Let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: We are all travelers in the wilderness of this world, and the best we can find in our travels is an honest friend.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Give yourself permission to slow down.
author: Gabby Bernstein

quote: Start prioritizing your mental health instead of adjusting to toxic spaces.
author: Thema Bryant-Davis

quote: Life gets better when health becomes your first priority.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: Trauma isn’t what happens to you, it’s what happens inside you.
author: Gabor Maté

quote: Meditate. It won’t be fun but it will surface what you need to deal with.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Digital addiction is going to be one of the great mental health crises of our time.
author: Sam Altman

quote: There is no health without mental health.
author: David Satcher

quote: Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace.
author: Robert J. Sawyer

quote: Sobriety is a myth, you always find a new addiction.
author: Thibaut

quote: We have so many drugs now, electronic and chemical, that most of us are junkies most of the time.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: More drugs are taken to quiet the mind than to heal the body.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Persistent, non-specific anxiety is the result of wanting so much, talking so much, and doing so much that you lose touch with the quiet joys of solitude.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: There is hope, even when your brain tells you there isn’t.
author: John Green

quote: Depression is a liar. Anxiety is a deceiver. PTSD is a trickster. As we heal, we gain more clarity.
author: Thema Bryant-Davis

quote: The largest part of what we call ‘personality’ is determined by how we’ve opted to defend ourselves against anxiety and sadness.
author: Alain de Botton

quote: Whatever your experience with mental illness, you deserve to be heard, to be understood and to get help if you need it.
author: Haley Quinn

quote: Identification with our mind causes thought to become compulsive.
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: Don’t expect inner peace if you still hate your past.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: If you take care of your mind, you take care of the world.
author: Arianna Huffington

quote: Sometimes the only thing you could do for people was to be there.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Not until we are lost do we begin to understand ourselves.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion.
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: The thing I’m most afraid of is me. Of not knowing what I’m going to do. Of not knowing what I’m doing right now.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: Real loneliness is not necessarily limited to when you are alone.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Numbing the pain for a while will make it worse when you finally feel it.
author: Albus Dumbledore

quote: The worst part of having a mental illness is people expect you to behave as if you don’t.
author: Joker

quote: Silence is a place of great power and healing.
author: Rachel Naomi Remen

quote: Self-forgiveness can heal you.
author: Andrew Zaffina

quote: It doesn’t hurt me unless I interpret it’s happening as harmful to me. I can choose not to.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: A clear mind heals everything that needs to be healed.
author: Byron Katie

quote: Stop looking for happiness in the same place you lost it.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: If we are to nurture and heal, we must admit that the wounds exist.
author: Iyanla Vanzant

quote: Every breath and every step can be nourishing and healing.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: Healing is an art. It takes time, it takes practice. It takes love.
author: Maza Dohta

quote: I do not live for what the world thinks of me, but for what I think of myself.
author: Jack London

quote: The moment you start feeling whole and grateful is when your brain starts to begin healing.
author: Joe Dispenza

quote: Let go of anything that you don’t love about your life story and just keep the things you love.
author: Rhonda Byrne

quote: The more seriously you take yourself, the unhappier you’re going to be.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: As confusion disappears, so does suffering.
author: Ringu Tulku

quote: The key to dealing with pain is not minding that it hurts.
author: Ed Latimore

quote: Self-knowledge is the beginning of wisdom, which is the ending of fear.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Detachment is another way of reclaiming your power. Laughter is another way of healing.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: Simplicity begins when you stop believing everything you think.
author: Courtney Carver

quote: Healing does not mean going back to the way things were before, but rather allowing what is now to move us closer to God.
author: Ram Dass

quote: To solve all problems, be here, in reality, now. Recognize that they exist only in a past or a future.
author: Byron Katie

quote: The certainty you’re craving makes you suffer more than the uncertainty you’re avoiding.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: If you get your mind in order, everything else gets that much easier.
author: Mark Manson

quote: Healing doesn’t eliminate all the hard moments. It changes how you handle them.
author: Thema Bryant-Davis

quote: When there is complete understanding of oneself, then there is the ending of conflict.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: You can clutch the past so tightly to your chest that it leaves your arms too full to embrace the present.
author: Jan Glidewell

quote: At the center of all desires is the very one that is never examined: the desire to become happy.
author: James Pierce

quote: The things to which you are attached will take control of your life.
author: James Pierce

quote: World peace begins with inner peace.
author: 14th Dalai Lama

quote: Peace in ourselves, peace in the world.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: Don’t gain the world and lose your soul, wisdom is better than silver or gold.
author: Bob Marley

quote: You can’t shake hands with a clenched fist.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: First keep the peace within yourself, then you can also bring peace to others.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: In the midst of movement and chaos, keep stillness inside of you.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: If there must be trouble let it be in my day, that my child may have peace.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there’d be peace.
author: John Lennon

quote: You cannot find peace by avoiding life.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Make peace with your broken pieces.
author: Unknown

quote: Worrying does not take away tomorrow’s troubles, it takes away today’s peace.
author: Unknown

quote: There is no way to peace, peace is the way.
author: A.J. Muste

quote: Barbecue may not be the road to world peace, but it’s a start.
author: Anthony Bourdain

quote: The practice of peace and reconciliation is one of the most vital and artistic of human actions.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: The world is a dangerous place to live; not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don’t do anything about it.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Peace is not only better than war, but infinitely more arduous.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Peace is not achieved by controlling nations, but mastering our thoughts.
author: John Harricharan

quote: Peace is not the absence of war but the presence of justice.
author: Harrison Ford

quote: Peace is not the absence of war; it is a virtue; a state of mind; a disposition for benevolence; confidence; and justice.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Peace is costly but it is worth the expense.
author: African proverb

quote: Peace is the only battle worth waging.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Only art and music have the power to bring peace.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: We don’t realize that, somewhere within us all, there does exist a supreme self who is eternally at peace.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: The care of human life and happiness, and not their destruction, is the first and only object of good government.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Self-care is not a luxury, it’s a priority.
author: Kim Leyva

quote: Closing your eyes and listening to silence is self-care.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: Your opinion of you is the only thing that matters.
author: Gal Shapira

quote: The greatest thing you can give yourself is freedom from what others think.
author: Abraham Hicks

quote: Never love anyone who treats you like you’re ordinary.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Don’t say “maybe” if you want to say no.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Forgiving people in silence and never speaking to them again is a form of self-care.
author: Aaron Will

quote: Normalize not feeling guilty for putting yourself first.
author: Pammy

quote: The more we say yes, the more complex life gets.
author: Jack Butcher

quote: Self-hatred leads to the need either to dominate or to be dominated.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Self-care is showing up for yourself when others don’t.
author: Andrew Zaffina

quote: Self-care starts with having a regular exercise routine.
author: Dan Go

quote: Detaching from expectations is self-care.
author: Lance Cooper

quote: Everyone is not your assignment. That’s why you’re drained.
author: Wesley Snipes (Source)

quote: Protect your time at all costs. Protect your mind at all costs. Protect your mission at all costs. Protect your peace at all costs. You are a walking miracle.
author: Aaron Aalto

quote: It never ceases to amaze me: we all love ourselves more than other people, but care more about their opinions than our own.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The truest way to decline is just to say, “it doesn’t feel right to me.” No explanation is necessary.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Don’t wait for your doctor to prescribe meds before you start giving a fuck about your body.
author: Dan Go

quote: Self-discipline is the ultimate form of self-care.
author: Mark Manson

quote: Be ok with not being liked.
author: Gal Shapira

quote: As you get wiser, you stop caring about everything.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: Better focus follows better self-care.
author: Unknown

quote: Taking care is one way to show your love. Another way is letting people take good care of you when you need it.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: The ego wants to go fast. The soul needs to go slow.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: The quickest way to mediocrity is to try to make everyone happy, all of the time.
author: Mark Manson

quote: Take care of yourself before you take care of others.
author: Sachin Bansal

quote: People are trapped in history and history is trapped in them.
author: James Baldwin

quote: History is who we are and why we are the way we are.
author: David McCullough

quote: Revolutions are the locomotives of history.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Blood alone moves the wheels of history.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Fear not for the future, weep not for the past.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: History is merely a list of surprises. It can only prepare us to be surprised yet again.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: History is a relay of revolutions.
author: Saul Alinsky

quote: The past changes a little every time we retell it.
author: Hilary Mantel

quote: Anybody can make history. Only a great man can write it.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I can’t change history, I don’t want to change history. I can only change the future. I’m working on that.
author: Boris Becker

quote: Many of the greatest crimes in history were caused not by hatred, but rather by indifference. They were caused by people who could have done something, but did not even bother lifting a finger. So don’t wait. Get out there. Go and vote.
author: Yuval Noah Harari

quote: History repeats itself, first as tragedy, second as farce.
author: Karl Marx

quote: History is a set of lies agreed upon.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Neither the life of an individual nor the history of a society can be understood without understanding both.
author: C. Wright Mills

quote: Be honest. We have the science, the technology, and the wealth. What we don’t have is the will, and that’s not a reason that history will accept.
author: Bono

quote: History has demonstrated that the most notable winners usually encountered heartbreaking obstacles before they triumphed. They won because they refused to become discouraged by their defeats.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: I believe that we must maintain pride in the knowledge that the actions we take, based on our own decisions and choices as individuals, link directly to the magnificent challenge of transforming human history.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: There are still many causes worth sacrificing for, so much history yet to be made.
author: Michelle Obama

quote: Life moves fast. As much as you can, learn from your history, you have to move forward.
author: Eddie Vedder

quote: We don’t want tradition. We want to live in the present and the only history that is worth a tinker’s damn is the history we make today.
author: Henry Ford

quote: To study history means submitting to chaos and nevertheless retaining faith in order and meaning.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: History is not a burden on the memory but an illumination of the soul.
author: Lord Acton

quote: History is a pack of lies we play on the dead.
author: Voltaire

quote: Fellow citizens, we cannot escape history.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Thank you for coming. We’re gonna make some history together today.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: The man who has no sense of history, is like a man who has no ears or eyes.
author: Adolf Hitler

quote: A good newspaper should ‘bestir the people into an awareness of their own condition, provide inspiration for their thoughts and rouse them to pursue their true interests.”
author: Jack Knight

quote: Politics ought to be the part-time profession of every citizen who would protect the rights and privileges of free people and who would preserve what is good and fruitful in our national heritage.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Politics in America is the binding secular religion.
author: Theodore H. White

quote: We mean by ‘politics’ the people’s business — the most important business there is.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: Journalism’s first loyalty is to citizens.
author: Elements of Journalism

quote: I happen to think that American politics is one of the noblest arts of mankind; and I cannot do anything else but write about it.
author: Theodore H. White

quote: Ideas are great arrows, but there has to be a bow. And politics is the bow of idealism.
author: Bill Moyers

quote: Although he’s regularly asked to do so, God does not take sides in American politics.
author: George J. Mitchell

quote: Our liberty depends on the freedom of the press, and that cannot be limited without being lost.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The ballot box is the surest arbiter of disputes among free men.
author: James Buchanan

quote: You campaign in poetry. You govern in prose.
author: Mario Cuomo

quote: I am a man of fixed and unbending principles, the first of which is to be flexible at all times.
author: Everett Dirksen

quote: Winning may not be everything, but losing has little to recommend it.
author: Dianne Feinstein

quote: The essence of journalism is a discipline of verification.
author: Elements of Journalism

quote: More things in politics happen by accident or exhaustion than happen by conspiracy.
author: Jeff Greenfield

quote: Everybody’s for democracy in principle. It’s only in practice that the thing gives rise to stiff objections.
author: Meg Greenfield

quote: Whenever the people are well-informed, they can be trusted with their own government.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The First Lady is, and always has been, an unpaid public servant elected by her husband.
author: Lady Bird Johnson

quote: We are not afraid to entrust the American people with unpleasant facts, foreign ideas, alien philosophies, and competitive values. For a nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: We should realize that the average family in America spends five minutes a week on politics.
author: Celinda Lake

quote: Politics is an act of faith; you have to show some kind of confidence in the intellectual and moral capacity of the public.
author: George McGovern

quote: Turn on to politics, or politics will turn on you.
author: Ralph Nader

quote: The purpose of journalism is to provide people with the information they need to be free and self-governing.
author: Elements of Journalism

quote: Bad officials are elected by good citizens who do not vote.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: All politics is local.
author: Thomas P. “Tip” O’Neill

quote: Let me tell you, sisters, seeing dried egg on a plate in the morning is a lot dirtier than anything I’ve had to deal with in politics.
author: Ann Richards

quote: It was we, the people; not we, the white male citizens... who formed the Union.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: If particular care and attention is not paid to the ladies, we are determined to foment a rebellion, and will not hold ourselves bound by any laws in which we have no voice or representation.
author: Abigail Adams

quote: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: If a woman have a pint and a man a quart—why can’t she have her little pint full?
author: Sojourner Truth

quote: I do not wish them [women] to have power over men; but over themselves.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft

quote: A woman is not to marry a man merely because she is asked, or because he is attached to her, and can write a tolerable letter.
author: Jane Austen

quote: We cannot accept any code or creed that uniformly defrauds woman of all her natural rights.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: Let woman's claim be as broad in the concrete as the abstract. We take our stand on the solidarity of humanity, the oneness of life...
author: Anna Julia Cooper

quote: If we revert to history, we shall find that the women who have distinguished themselves have neither been the most beautiful nor the most gentle of their sex.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft

quote: Ships at a distance have every man's wish on board... The dream is the truth. They then act and do things accordingly.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: One of the simplest paths to deep change is for the less powerful to speak as much as they listen, and for the more powerful to listen as much as they speak.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Who knows what women can be when they are finally free to become themselves?
author: Betty Friedan

quote: Now, we are becoming the men we wanted to marry. Once, women were trained to marry a doctor, not be one.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: It is obvious that discrimination exists... The fact is that a woman who aspires to be chairman of the board, or a Member of the House, does so for exactly the same reasons as any man.
author: Shirley Chisholm

quote: The only way for a woman, as for a man, to find herself, to know herself as a person, is by creative work of her own.
author: Betty Friedan

quote: If the feminine issue is so absurd, is because the male's arrogance made it 'a discussion.’
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: As the sole woman in the civil rights leadership group, I was determined to bring wise women together to learn and gather strength from the experience.
author: Dorothy Height

quote: If I want to define myself, I first have to say, ‘I am a woman’; all other assertions will arise from this basic truth.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: The feminine mystique says that the highest value and the only commitment for women is the fulfillment of their own femininity.
author: Betty Friedan

quote: One person plus one typewriter constitutes a movement.
author: Pauli Murray

quote: It takes a great deal of courage and independence to decide to design your own image instead of the one that society rewards...
author: Germaine Greer

quote: Power is being redefined. Women often explain with care that we mean power to control our lives, but not to dominate others.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: The most 'emancipated' women ... showed a far greater capacity for complete sexual enjoyment.
author: Betty Friedan

quote: [Women] will not have to sacrifice the right to honorable competition and contribution anymore than they will have to sacrifice marriage and motherhood.
author: Betty Friedan

quote: Why is it acceptable for women to be secretaries, librarians, and teachers, but totally unacceptable for them to be managers, administrators, doctors, lawyers, and Members of Congress?
author: Shirley Chisholm

quote: I would like to ask that we begin to dream about and plan for a different world. A fairer world... We must raise our daughters differently. We must also raise our sons differently.
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
